West_Allis.American Family Insurance Amphitheater: The American Family Insurance Amphitheater (formerly known as the Marcus Amphitheater) is an amphitheater on the south end of the Henry Maier Festival Park (also known locally as the Summerfest grounds) in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. The amphitheater was built after an extremely overcrowded Huey Lewis and the News concert in 1984, which drew 30,000 fans to a space suited for 15,000 [1]. The amphitheatre capacity 25,000 (9,200 seats under pavilion, 7,000 reserved seats on lawn and 8,800 general admission seats).
